title: Strengthening E-Learning Practical Competencies: Managing Cognitive and Metacognitive Load in Computer-Based Learning Environments

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic cognitive science and learning theories, computer literacy
context.additional_context: Competency enhancement program for professionals in education/teaching/learning fields

learning_goals: Learners can explain at least three strategies for effectively integrating multimodal representations in computer-based environments.
Learners can structure project deliverables according to design principles for learning materials that consider working memory capacity.
Learners can develop plans to reduce cognitive load during the learning process by over 20% using metacognitive self-regulation techniques.
Learners can provide feedback on peers' learning designs at least three times using Cognitive Load Theory (CLT)-based formative assessment tools.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
